title: EPISTOLA Ed Rosenberg
html:
EPISTOLA Ed Rosenberg

I am half Italian, even have an Italian highschool degree. I recently returned from a visit to Firenze and can corroborate Mr. Gani's most interesting article.

Around 1980, when working in Switzerland, I noticed that at least the German Swiss were not very good with their Anglicisms: In Zürich there was a small, elegant ladies' apparel store that called itself “Boutique Ripoff”, possibly because it sounded so Russian; and in Davos I saw a sign on a store that proclaimed: “Come in, it is open”, unaware of our “we are open” and simply translating the standard German signs thaty read: “Es ist offen”.

Best wishes to you and to Mr.Gani,

[Felix R Rosenthal]
